i m not talking about the network at all networks can always go underground and i agree there s no way to stop it i m talking about the monetary value of btc because currently what we re doing is exchanging fiat for btc btc can still be used for the exchange of tangible products like the examples you stated but what s stopping the us gov to officially and outright declare btc an illegal currency imposing hefty finesjail term on businesses big and small if they were caught transacting in btc do you still think businesses would risk accepting them it will slowly but surely fade away the monetary value for the exchange of physical goods of btc another example i walk into a store with a kilo of drugscontrolled substance in exchange for a van of soda that kilo definitely has much much much more monetary value but it s illegal for the business to accept it yes some businesses would still take it but most wo nt in layman terms what if the future of btc is actually just a super fancy technologically perfect hyped up digital ingame currency it has it s own value tagged to it but not something you can live off it monetarywordly value you spent years exchanging and dcaing fiat for it but you ca nt actually use it if regulations are officially imposed on a global scale get what i m trying to say
